title: 108_s171
content: The Act titled "Medicare Ambulance Payment Reform Act of 2003" establishes new payment rates for ambulance services. The Medicare Ambulance Payment Reform Act of 2003 amends payment rates for ground ambulance services under the Social Security Act. The Medicare Ambulance Payment Reform Act of 2003 adjusts rates for ground ambulance services based on average costs incurred by full cost ambulance suppliers. The Medicare Ambulance Payment Reform Act of 2003 adjusts rates for ground ambulance services based on costs incurred by full cost ambulance suppliers with less than 20% volunteers and free capital assets. The Medicare Ambulance Payment Reform Act of 2003 adjusts rates for ambulance services based on costs incurred by full cost ambulance suppliers with less than 20% volunteers and free capital assets. Payment rates for ambulance services in subsequent years are set by the Secretary under a fee schedule, with increases tied to the Consumer Price Index for all urban consumers. The Medicare Ambulance Payment Reform Act of 2003 adjusts rates for ambulance services based on costs incurred by full cost ambulance suppliers in low density rural areas. The Secretary will adjust fee schedule payment rates for ambulance services provided in these areas to account for increased costs. The Medicare Ambulance Payment Reform Act of 2003 adjusts rates for ambulance services based on costs incurred by full cost ambulance suppliers in low density rural areas. Section 221(c) of the Medicare, Medicaid, and SCHIP Benefits Improvement and Protection Act of 2000 is repealed, and a coding system for ambulance services is established under Section 1834(l)(7) of the Social Security Act. The coding system for ambulance services is established under Section 1834(l)(7) of the Social Security Act, taking into account a list of medical conditions and adopted as a standard code set.
